intro: Moldenhawera intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate moldenhawera, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided lobes and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its root system is fibrous, and it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native habitats.
